snippet: A report on Syrian child labor by Save the Children and Unicef suggested a majority of Syrian children are now working to support their families.
abstract: Save the Children and United Nations Children's Fund report that more than 75 percent of Syrian households have had children working rather than attending school since civil war began ravaging country; fact that children are missing years of school, in country that previously boasted literacy rate of 90 percent, has triggered fears of a lost generation.
lead_paragraph: A report on Syrian child labor by Save the Children and Unicef suggested a majority of Syrian children are now working to support their families.

headline.main: Child Labor Rises Sharply in Syria, Upended by War and Mayhem
headline.print_headline: Child Labor Rises Sharply in Syria Unrest
